oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Information on the Great Smoky Mountains National Park
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Information on the Great Smoky Mountains National Park, provided to Governor Prentice Coooper for the preparation of his dedication speech.

In September of 1940, President Franklin D. Roosevelt came to East Tennessee to officially dedicate the Great Smoky Mountains National Park. The President delivered his address at Newfound Gap at the main crest of the mountains that serves as a boundary between Tennessee and North Carolina.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: New Deal, 1933-1939; Great Smoky Mountains National Park (N.C. and Tenn.); Roosevelt, Franklin D. (Franklin Delano), 1882-1945
